thread.title: What Are the Major Airlines in China?
thread.title_full: What Are the Major Airlines in China?

title: What Are the Major Airlines in China?
text:
Updated Articles and Resources China, one of the largest and fastest-growing aviation markets in the world, has a vast array of airlines for domestic and international travel. Since many folks come to China on package tours, it is easy to be completely unaware of what airline you're traveling with. However, if you're booking your own way, knowing who operates out of where can be a big help in purchasing tickets. Discount airlines, like Spring Airlines, won't come up in search, so it's helpful to check them out for discounts. And it's also nice to know with whom the airlines are partners, so you can rack up some extra miles along the way. An airplane in China. Frank Short/Getty Images • Air China 
Air China is one of China's largest carriers and has flights all over China, Asia and the rest of the world. As a Star Alliance member, Air China flights on the same routes as its partner can be a cheaper option but airplanes are typically rather old with few modern amenities (like overhead lights that work). Chinese Name: 中国国际航空公司 How to pronounce the Chinese Name: zhong gwoh gwoh gee hahng kong gong sih Airline Code: CA Partnerships and Frequent Flyer Programs: Star Alliance and PhoenixMiles Symbol: a stylized red phoenix • China Eastern Airlines 
Based in Shanghai, China Eastern operates domestic flights all over China as well as strong international flight routes. Chinese Name: 中国东方航空公司 How to pronounce the Chinese Name: zhong gwoh dong fahng hahng kong gong sih Airline Code: MU Partnerships and Frequent Flyer Programs: Star Alliance and Eastern Miles Symbol: a white bird on a blue and red background 
Based in Guangzhou, China Southern serves mostly southern China but also operates many Asia and broader international flights. It touts a relatively modern fleet of airplanes. Chinese Name: 中国南方航空公司 How to pronounce the Chinese Name: zhong gwoh nahn fahng hahng kong gong sih Airline Code: CZ Partnerships and Frequent Flyer Programs: Sky Pearl Club and Sky Team Symbol: stylized red kapok flower on a blue background
